meanings.definition: Capable of bending easily without breaking.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was flexible and stretched easily.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast showed her flexible body during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The flexible straw danced in the wind, amusing the children.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was as flexible as a rubber band, adapting to new ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches swayed in the wind, showing how flexible they were.

meanings.definition: Able to be easily modified or adapted.
meanings.sent1: The schedule was flexible, allowing for changes to be made easily.
meanings.sent2: The software had a flexible interface that could be customized by users.
meanings.sent3: The flexible plan saved the day when unexpected guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as flexible as clay, molding to new information effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was so flexible that it could be twisted and turned in any direction.

meanings.sent1: She was flexible in her decision-making, always open to new suggestions.
meanings.sent2: Being flexible in negotiations can lead to finding common ground.
meanings.sent3: The flexible attitude of the team members made the project enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: His heart was as flexible as a spring, bouncing back from disagreements easily.
meanings.sent5: The politician's stance was so flexible that it adapted to every audience.
